intro: Gongylolepis pedunculata, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color, and it blooms from spring to summer. Gongylolepis pedunculata is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
